1.content: Blessed is the man that hath not slipped by a word out of his mouth, and is not pricked with the remorse of sin.

2.content: Happy is he that hath had no sadness of his mind, and who is not fallen from his hope.

3.content: Riches are not comely for a covetous man and a niggard, and what should an envious man do with gold?

4.content: He that gathereth together by wronging his own soul, gathereth for others, and another will squander away his goods in rioting.

5.content: He that is evil to himself, to whom will he be good? and he shall not take pleasure in his goods.

6.content: There is none worse than he that envieth himself, and this is the reward of his wickedness:

7.content: And if he do good, he doth it ignorantly, and unwillingly: and at the last he discovereth his wickedness.

8.content: The eye of the envious is wicked: and he turneth away his face, and despiseth his own soul.

9.content: The eye of the covetous man is insatiable in his portion of iniquity: he will not be satisfied till he consume his own soul, drying it up.

10.content: An evil eye is towards evil things: and he shall not have his fill of bread, but shall be needy and pensive at his own table.

11.content: My son, if thou have any thing, do good to thyself, and offer to God worthy offerings.

12.content: Remember that death is not slow, and that the covenant of hell hath been shewn to thee: for the covenant of this world shall surely die.

13.content: Do good to thy friend before thou die, and according to thy ability, stretching out thy hand give to the poor.

14.content: Defraud not thyself of the good day, and let not the part of a good gift overpass thee.

15.content: Shalt thou not leave to others to divide by lot thy sorrows and labours?

16.content: Give and take, and justify thy soul.

17.content: Before thy death work justice: for in hell there is no finding food.

18.content: All flesh shall fade as grass, and as the leaf that springeth out on a green tree.

19.content: Some grow, and some fall off: so is the generation of flesh and blood, one cometh to an end, and another is born.

20.content: Every work that is corruptible shall fail in the end: and the worker thereof shall go with it.

21.content: And every excellent work shall be justified: and the worker thereof shall be honoured therein.

22.content: Blessed is the man that shall continue in wisdom, and that shall meditate in his justice, and in his mind shall think of the all seeing eye of God.

23.content: He that considereth her ways in his heart, and hath understanding in her secrets, who goeth after her as one that traceth, and stayeth in her ways.

24.content: He who looketh in at her windows, and hearkeneth at her door.

25.content: He that lodgeth near her house, and fastening a pin in her walls shall set up his tent high unto her, where good things shall rest in his lodging for ever.

26.content: He shall set his children under her shelter, and shall lodge under her branches:

27.content: He shall be protected under her covering from the heat, and shall rest in her glory.

disclaimer: This book is an addition to the Old Testament. It is not found in the Hebrew or Aramaic texts, but are found in the Greek Septuagint and the Latin Vulgate.
